data.title: All 38 Liv Tyler Movies (in Order)

data.text:
Are you a fan of Liv Tyler, the talented actress known for her roles in blockbuster movies like â€œLord of the Ringsâ€ and â€œArmageddonâ€?

If so, get ready to embark on a cinematic journey as we take a closer look at the diverse range of movies in which Liv Tyler has starred. From action-packed thrillers to romantic dramas, our roundup of Liv Tylerâ€™s filmography covers it all. Join us as we revisit some of her most memorable on-screen performances and delve into her inspiring career.

1. Silent Fall (1994)

In the gripping 1994 drama â€œSilent Fall, â€œ a young autistic boy named Jamie (played by Skylar Astin) witnesses his parentsâ€™ brutal murder. As police struggle to uncover the truth behind the gruesome crime, a controversial therapist named Dr. Kessler (John Lithgow) boldly seeks to delve into Jamieâ€™s mind. To crack the dark family secret, Dr. Kessler must confront his own limits and the complexities of the human spirit.

2. Aerosmith: Big Ones You Can Look At (1994)

Aerosmith: Big Ones You Can Look Atâ€ is a captivating home video accompaniment to the bandâ€™s compilation album, â€œBig Ones. â€œ This 1994 release presents all of Aerosmithâ€™s music videos from their Geffen Records era, promising fans an immersive musical experience. The video features various exhilarating elements, including motorcycles, skydiving, computer animations, and virtual reality. Directed by renowned filmmakers Marty Callner and David Fincher, this one-hour forty-minute celebration of Aerosmithâ€™s music highlights their iconic hits and the bandâ€™s undeniable charisma.

4. Heavy (1995)

Heavyâ€, a 1995 drama-romance film directed and written by James Mangold, explores the life of an overweight, unhappy cook who works alongside his mother at a road-side restaurant. His lonely existence is turned upside down when a kind and beautiful college drop-out comes to work as a waitress at the same establishment.

5. That Thing You Do! (1996)

That Thing You Do! â€œ is a heartwarming and nostalgic musical comedy-drama released in 1996, directed and written by Tom Hanks himself. Set in the iconic 1960s, this captivating tale follows a local band from Erie, Pennsylvania, as they experience a burst of fame with their one-hit wonder in 1964. The movie is filled with laughter and emotional highs and lows as the members of the band and their dedicated manager navigate the intricacies of the music industry.

Stealing Beautyâ€ is a gripping drama, mystery, and romance film directed by renowned filmmaker Bernardo Bertolucci, revolving around a young womanâ€™s journey to self-discovery and love. Set against the backdrop of Tuscany, it follows its protagonist, who seeks solace from the heartbreak of her motherâ€™s suicide. As she embarks on a profound exploration of her identity, she encounters a complex web of deep emotions, love, and self-exploration that eventually lead to her sexual awakening.

8. U Turn (1997)

Directed by Oliver Stone and written by John Ridley, U Turn is a gripping crime drama that follows the story of a man on a desperate mission to pay off his gambling debt before he is killed by the Russian mafia. However, his journey takes an unexpected detour through an Arizona town, where everything goes terribly wrong.

Onegin, â€œ a 1999 period drama film directed by Martha Fiennes, takes place in Russia in the 1820s. Onegin befriends his neighbor, Lensky, and they encounter Tatyana, a woman who falls deeply in love with Onegin. However, Onegin only desires friendship from Tatyana, leaving her heartsick and tormented.

18. Jersey Girl (2004)

Jersey Girlâ€ is a heartwarming comedy-drama film released in 2004, starring Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, and Raquel Castro. The film follows a widower named Ollie Trinke, portrayed by Affleck, who is left to raise his precocious daughter after facing an unexpected tragedy and a professional setback. Directed by Kevin Smith, this movie takes the audience on a roller coaster ride of emotions as Ollie tries to make sense of his newfound responsibilities and rebuild his life.

19. The 76th Annual Academy Awards (2004)

The 76th Annual Academy Awards, also known as the Oscars, is a prestigious annual event where the film industry comes together to celebrate cinematic achievements of the previous year. The 2004 ceremony showcases a range of nominated films, including epic masterpiece â€œThe Return of the King, â€œ the poignant drama â€œLost in Translation, â€œ the historical epic â€œMaster and Commander, â€œ the gripping crime-thriller â€œMystic River, â€œ and the heartwarming sports story â€œSeabiscuit. â€œ The event, hosted by the talented Billy Crystal, is renowned for its live performances, humorous moments, and heartwarming tributes to the film industry. This Academy Awards ceremony, held in 2004, demonstrates the extraordinary talents and contributions of the film industry in the 2000s, with a remarkable lineup of nominees and an unforgettable night of celebration.

Happy Birthday Elton! From Madison Square Garden, New Yorkâ€ captures the essence of an iconic moment in history. The Incredible Hulkâ€ (2008) brings the green-skinned, mighty Marvel character to life once more. As he gets pressured by his ambitious wife about starting a family, his life takes a sudden turn when his controlling mother decides to move in with the couple. â€œSmotherâ€ is a story of love, family, and the struggle to find a balance between parental expectations and personal ambitions.

37. Wildling (2018)

Wildling, released in 2018, is a captivating drama, fantasy, and horror film that tells the story of a young teenagerâ€™s journey towards uncovering the truth about her tumultuous past. Starring an excellent ensemble cast, including Bel Powley, Brad Dourif, and Liv Tyler, the film follows the protagonistâ€™s blossoming teenage years as she wrestles with the dark secrets hidden within her traumatic experiences. 38. Ad Astra (2019)

Ad Astra is a gripping adventure drama set against the vast, unforgiving landscape of space. Written and directed by James Gray, the movie follows astronaut Roy McBride (Brad Pitt) on an epic journey across the solar system in search of the truth about his missing father, who was part of a doomed expedition that now, 30 years later, poses a grave threat to the universe.
